intro: Cactus isabellinus, commonly known as the Isabelline cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, spineless cactus with a thick, ribbed stem that stores water efficiently. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are modified into spines, reducing water loss and providing protection from herbivores. The Isabelline cactus is well adapted to desert environments, showcasing the unique botanical features of succulent plants.
